description:
Aphanothece stagnina RSMan2012 is a species of cyanobacteria, which are photosynthetic, prokaryotic organisms. This particular strain was isolated from a freshwater lake environment.

Cyanobacteria are known for their ability to form colonies or aggregates, and Aphanothece stagnina RSMan2012 is no exception. It exhibits a characteristic colonial morphology, with cells embedded in a gelatinous matrix.

Genetically, Aphanothece stagnina RSMan2012 has been characterized and its genome sequenced. This has provided insights into its metabolic capabilities, which likely include the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen and carry out oxygenic photosynthesis, common features of many cyanobacterial species.

As a freshwater cyanobacterium, Aphanothece stagnina RSMan2012 plays a role in the aquatic ecosystem, contributing to primary productivity and nutrient cycling. Its study may provide valuable information about the diversity and functional roles of cyanobacteria in natural environments.
